p:
Singh et al.
29 originally extracted actinoplanic acid A ( 94) from Actinoplanes sp. and determined its structure. Compound 94 was found to compete with FPP and was also a selective inhibitor of FTase (IC 50 = 230 nM). Subsequently, actinoplanic acid B ( 95) was extracted from Actinoplanes sp., which also exerts selective and competitive inhibition of FTase and has stronger inhibitory activity (IC 50 = 50 nM)
30
,
114 . When analysing the structure, we found that compounds 94 and 95 carried more groups similar to FPP, just as Singh et al. found that they could compete with FPP to inhibit FTase, with strong inhibitory activity.
